newsitem.title: GERMANY: Waigel indicates new tax rates within target area.
newsitem.headline: Waigel indicates new tax rates within target area.

text.p: Finance Minister Theo Waigel indicated on Tuesday that plans by a tax reform commission to cut income tax rates to 19 to 39 percent were within the target zone.
"That is in the region that the (coalition parties) have been aiming for," Waigel told reporters.
Coalition sources said the tax reform commission is choosing between a linear-progressive tax scale from 19 to 39 percent and one with five tax brackets between 10 and 39 percent.
Waigel said recently the two models would bring in roughly the same revenues. Another proposed model with three brackets was inadequate, he said.
The commission is due to unveil its plan on January 23, but the outline has already been widely discussed in the media. The bulk of the plan is to take effect in 1999.
The current top income tax rate is 53 percent, and the bottom rate is 26 percent.
